metadata.title: CVE-2022-48843 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:drm/vrr: Set VRR capable prop only if it is attached to connectorVRR capable property is not attached by default to the connectorIt is attached only if VRR is supported.So if the driver tries to call drm core set prop function withoutit being attached that causes NULL dereference.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-48843` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1027-fips - 4.15.0-1027.32
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2000-aws-fips - 4.15.0-2000.4
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-1002-azure-fips - 4.15.0-1002.2
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

linux-image-unsigned-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
linux-image-unsigned-hmac-4.15.0-2013-gcp-fips - 4.15.0-2013.14
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro
